abstract: HSBC Holdings, Europe’s largest bank, has agreed to sell its New York City headquarters for $330 million in cash to a company controlled by Israeli businessman Nochi Dankner.
snippet: HSBC Holdings, Europe’s largest bank, has agreed to sell its New York City headquarters for $330 million in cash to a company controlled by Israeli businessman Nochi Dankner.
lead_paragraph: HSBC Holdings, Europe’s largest bank, has reached a deal to unload its New York City headquarters for $330 million in cash to a company controlled by the Israeli businessman, Nochi Dankner, Bloomberg News writes.

headline.main: HSBC Sells New York Headquarters for $330 Million
